alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 1:47PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Multiple rounds of moderate to heavy snow and strong winds expected. Snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches and wind gusts up to 60 MPH with the first round tonight through Sunday. Then, additional accumulations of 18 inches or more possible with winds gusting as high as 80 MPH with the next round late Sunday night through early Thursday. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel could be very difficult to impossible due to near zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow, especially with the second round Monday through Wednesday. Outdoor recreation could become life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers, skiers, and snowmobilers may easily become lost or disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a long duration event. While there may be occasional lulls in snowfall, periodic moderate to heavy snowfall with very strong winds will be possible from Sunday through early Thursday, and possibly longer. Strong winds and blowing snow with possible whiteout conditions will be possible even during lulls in falling snow. Be prepared for several days of difficult conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
